author: Staff Reporter
text:
The Communist Party of India (M-L) will contest in four Assembly constituencies in the Union Territory in the May 16 Assembly polls. A resolution was adopted at a two-day State conference of the party here on Monday.

Through another resolution, the party urged the Union government to enact special legislation to prevent honour killings in the country.

The CPI (M-L) said that the five-year rule of the AINRC in Puducherry was marked by corruption. The conference unanimously elected a new committee for the Puducherry unit of the party comprising State secretary S. Balasubramanian, K. Palani and S. Motilal among others.

Urges Centre to bring in special legislation to prevent honour killings
title: CPI (M-L) to contest in 4 constituencies
